alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 12 at 11:49AM CST until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Nebraska... North Platte River at North Platte affecting Lincoln County. .Elevated river levels will continue along the North Platte River at North Platte over the next several days. This is caused by ice jamming along the river. At this time, river levels should remain just under flood stage, however minor fluctuations are possible. For the North Platte River...including North Platte...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...North Platte River at North Platte. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Minor flood stage. Minor flooding begins in low lying and agricultural areas along the south bank of the North Platte River. Flooding of yards between the golf course and Buffalo Bill Campground are possible. Minor water intrusions into low lying areas of Cody Park in North Platte begins. People should use caution in the water and along the banks of the river, especially near Cody Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady just below flood stage at 5.9 feet. Minor fluctuations are possible. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 10 AM CT Saturday.Saturday morning at 1100 AM CST.
